snippet: For the second consecutive series in the N.H.L. playoffs, the Rangers won Game 1, but lost Game 2 after the opposition made timely tactical changes.
abstract: New York Rangers are preparing for Game 3 of Eastern Conference semifinals against Washington Capitals; series is tied 1-1. (M)
lead_paragraph: As the Rangers boarded a train at Pennsylvania Station on Tuesday to take them to Washington, they may have had an uneasy feeling. They are the No. 1-seeded playoff team in the Eastern Conference, earning clear victories in Game 1 of their two playoff series, but losing both Game 2s at home. In each case, the Ottawa Senators and the Capitals made sudden tactical adjustments that confounded the Rangers. ''A number of things I think we did really well, and some things we need to improve on,'' Coach John Tortorella said after an optional practice at Madison Square Garden. He was as testy as he was Monday night after the Capitals' 3-2 victory tied the series at a game each. He refused to elaborate, even getting into a snappish exchange with a reporter.

headline.main: For Rangers, the Playoffs Becoming the Old Grind
